intro: Cnidium venosum, commonly known as the veined cnidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cnidium venosum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas.
